column15: I have worked for Brainwave for a little time. Brainwave is a national non-profit organization. I am also currently part of STEM community for Pakistan, as I am an alumni of International Chemistry Olympiad (IChO).
column16: I have participated in International Chemistry Olympiad in 2023 that was held in Switzerland. I have a keen interest in STEM subjects as they capture my attention through mind-bending concepts. In Switzerland, I networked with international students of same interest and I liked working in that environment a lot. So I would like to work in a similar environment again, as it'll allow me to learn and grow further.

column13: This is a great opportunity as it is something that would help me to do something other than academics. By being part of this, I hope I would gain more indepth knowledge, experience and good skills about things. Additionally, it would help me in building a good portfolio. Moreover, it grants many opportunities that I really love such as writing, research work and communicating the limited scientific knowledge I have. By being the part of this journey, I can not only learn new skills but also have some fun as I would be doing what I like.
column15: Yes! I worked with Empowered Pakistan, recently. They ran a program ENRIP-2025 which aimed to focus on developing Research skills related to literature review.
column16: I am in the last year of college. I belong from Azad Kashmir-Rawalakot. I study Physics, Mathematics and Computer Science. I am trying to develop good programing skills in Python. However, I love Physics and Mathematics a lot. More specifically, I am highly passionate about Physics and aim to become a successful Physicist in future, In-Sha-Allah ! In conclusion, I am always looking up for opportunities related to Science, Research work, writing and teaching the things I know to others as this is all that I love to do and where my future education path leads me.

column13: I am a grade 11 student who is still trying to discover herself. I think being a part of this platform would help pave a way aligning with my academic goals. Plus, being a physics enthusiast, I think this is a great opportunity for me and other students.
column15: Being a part of a non profit would be a new and hopefully enriching experience for me. However, I have previously been part of STEM-related activities that show my willingness to keep learning. I participated in Researchathon 2025 (science fair organized by my college) where I made an MIT-inspired atmospheric water harvesting system. I also participated in NASA Space Apps Challenge in 2023, where we designed a hothetical habitable exoplanet as a team. Moreover, I attended a Math+CS Winter School, StemX at IBA, Karachi, where I learned introductory university level concepts of Physics, Mathematics, and Computer Science in a week. Through all these experiences, I learned how to work patiently on a problem, and continue learning even when concepts were challenging or unfamiliar.
column16:
I am a physics lover. Keeping me a part of it would be beneficial for me and you.
Plus, my hobbies include reading books for self development, solving puzzles,  and staring at countries' maps in my atlas.
